com.google.android.exoplayer2.extractor.mkv

Interface EbmlReader

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultEbmlReader 

    interface EbmlReader
    Event-driven EBML reader that delivers events to an EbmlReaderOutput.

    EBML can be summarized as a binary XML format somewhat similar to Protocol Buffers. It was originally designed for the Matroska container format. More information about EBML and Matroska is available here.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int TYPE_BINARY
      Type for binary elements.
      static int TYPE_FLOAT
      Type for IEEE floating point value elements of either 4 or 8 bytes.
      static int TYPE_MASTER
      Type for elements that contain child elements.
      static int TYPE_STRING
      Type for string elements.
      static int TYPE_UNKNOWN
      Type for unknown elements.
      static int TYPE_UNSIGNED_INT
      Type for integer value elements of up to 8 bytes.

    • Method Summary

      Initializes the extractor with an EbmlReaderOutput.

      Reads from an ExtractorInput, invoking an event callback if possible.

      Resets the state of the reader.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init(EbmlReaderOutput output)
        Initializes the extractor with an EbmlReaderOutput.
        Parameters:
        output - An EbmlReaderOutput to receive events.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resets the state of the reader.

        Subsequent calls to read(ExtractorInput) will start reading a new EBML structure from scratch.

      • read

        boolean read(ExtractorInput input)
      throws java.io.IOException,
             java.lang.InterruptedException
        Reads from an ExtractorInput, invoking an event callback if possible.
        Parameters:
        input - The ExtractorInput from which data should be read.
        Returns:
        True if data can continue to be read. False if the end of the input was encountered.
        Throws:
        ParserException - If parsing fails.
        java.io.IOException - If an error occurs reading from the input.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted.
